Class UltraSimpleStorage<T extends Serializable>

java.lang.Object
storage.UltraSimpleStorage<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of object to store (must be Serializable)
Direct Known Subclasses:
BudgetStorage, ExpenseStorage, IncomeStorage, ReminderStorage, UserStorage
public abstract class UltraSimpleStorage<T extends Serializable> extends Object
Abstract class for file-based storage of serializable objects in the Flossy Personal Finance Manager system. Handles save, load, add, remove, and getAll operations for a list of objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • UltraSimpleStorage

      public UltraSimpleStorage(String filename)
      Constructs an UltraSimpleStorage with the given filename. Loads existing data if available, otherwise starts with an empty list.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file to store the objects

  • Method Details

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      Saves the current list of objects to the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if file writing fails

    • load

      public List<T> load() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads the list of objects from the file.
      Returns:
      The loaded list of objects
      Throws:
      IOException - if file reading fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if deserialization fails

      Removes an object from the storage.
      Parameters:

    • getAll

      public List<T> getAll()
      Gets all objects currently in storage.
      Returns:
